textAfterTable: Located in the Udam Singh Nagar district of the state of Uttarakhand Rudrapur is an ancient town which is a perfect blend of history and culture. The city has a unique and rich history of over 500 years and at present it is seen as the commercial hub of the region. The city was founded by a Hindu tribal chief Rudra therefore the city is named ‘Rudrapur’. In the year 1960 people of Pakistan West Punjab and Myanmar established a refugee camp here. Beside the local Kumaonis and Garhwalis the town is inhabited by people following diverse religions. Situated in the center of mountain ranges of the mighty Himalayas the city also reflects the attractive side of nature. You can find the town’s culture in its folk dances as well as festivals.   There are numbers of places to visit in the town where you can go and have a time. There are some of the well known places that are quite popular amongst the tourists including Atariya Temple Chaiti Devi Temple Maa Mansa Devi Temple Moteshwar Mahadeva Temple Giri Sarovar Jaspur Gularbhoj Gosukuan Chakarpu and Senapani. The city is also a perfect shopping hub for the travelers as here you will find numbers of markets. For food lovers the city has a lot to offer. Here one will find best in class restaurants which provide delicious cuisines. Due to the pleasant weather throughout the year
